alert.note: Alert for Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 9:44PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Iowa...Illinois... Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Mercer, Henderson, Louisa and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Rock Island, Louisa, Muscatine and Mercer Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Iowa...Illinois... Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16. * WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Water floods Second Street in Andalusia in the unprotected area. Water is also at the foundations of several homes in Midway Beach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning and continue rising to 18.6 feet next Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon.
